pullRequest.title: BAEL-4460: Java AES encryption and decryption

nodes.bodyText: Let's revert the changes to the README.md - The editorial team will take care of this change.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -12,4 +12,5 @@ This module contains articles about core Java Security
 - [How to Read PEM File to Get Public and Private Keys](https://www.baeldung.com/java-read-pem-file-keys)
 - [Listing the Available Cipher Algorithms](https://www.baeldung.com/java-list-cipher-algorithms)
 - [Get a List of Trusted Certificates in Java](https://www.baeldung.com/java-list-trusted-certificates)
+- [Java AES encryption and decryption](https://www.baeldung.com/)

nodes.bodyText:
If you want to break the method line over two lines, I think the comma on the second line should go after iv e.g
public static void encryptFile(String algorithm, SecretKey key, IvParameterSpec iv,
    File inputFile, File outputFile) throws IOException {

I also think the indentation isn't quite right, it seems to be 8 spaces?
Feel free to take a look at our eclipse formatter if that helps:

https://github.com/eugenp/tutorials/blob/master/eclipse/formatter.xml

However, the exception formatting looks quite nice and the eclipse formatter won't respect that.
I guess we can make the logger private and final as well and have it in capitals?
Let's also remove this unused annotation for Spring Boot.
Do we need this empty test?
How about using a try/with resources for these streams or include a finally block. In your example, if there is an exception the streams aren't closed.
This method seems to be deprecated, is there an alternative we can use?

commit.message:
Revert "update README file"

This reverts commit 6f32d475

add clean up files
improve code quality

edit logger code
improve code quality
remove try/catch block and add throw clause
